other_tests.findings: Intermittent asymmetry with posterior right-hemisphere background slowing; considered artifact.
Absence of white cells and organisms, normal protein and glucose content, positive CSF LISA screen for Lyme disease.
other_tests.changes_over_time: 1gM antibodies present after 1 month of antibiotic therapy, consistent with acute Borrelia infection.

other_tests.findings: Inconsistent pattern of mild right-hemisphere brain dysfunction; mild impairment in nonverbal information processing and problem solving.
Lower than normal blood flow in the frontotemporal regions bilaterally, suggestive of an obliterative process in the midsized blood vessels.
Short sleep latency in a series of five naps and REM sleep in three of the five naps.
Patient recalled an apparent molestation while under hypnosis; memory remains disputed.
Scattered punctate foci of signal abnormality in the subcortical white matter, predominantly in the frontal lobes.
